snippet: Even by the standards of destitution in Afghan refugee camps, the story of Sayid Mohammad is a hard-luck one.
abstract: Leaders of refugee camp in Afghanistan say that 16 children aged 5 or younger have died here in the unseasonably cold weather and heavy snow that are keeping nighttime temperatures in the mid-teens; eight other children have died similarly in another Kabul camp; war refugee Sayid Mohammad loses his last son, 3-month-old Khan, who became the 24th child to die of exposure in camps.
lead_paragraph: Even by the standards of destitution in Afghan refugee camps, the story of Sayid Mohammad is a hard-luck one.

headline.seo: In Grip of Cold, Afghan Family Buries 8th Child
headline.main: In Grip of Cold, Afghan Family Buries 8th Child
headline.print_headline: In Grip of Cold, Afghan Family Buries Its 8th Child
